sub_title: Project Management PRINCE2®I Sustainability | Urban Development | Land use Planning | Development Management
summary: Strategic/development specialist and a professional Environmental Planner with eight years of experience in the development sector. Has expertise in urban planning, policy analysis, investment appraisal, project management, administration, and stakeholder management. Established partnerships and coordinated with the public sector, non-government organizations, development banks, and the private sector. With passion for sustainable development, inclusive growth, disaster risk reduction, climate resilience, and international development.  Committed to quality-, detail-, and result-oriented outputs that foster cross-team collaboration and teamwork. Dedicated to learning new skills, managing risks, and ensuring cross-functional collaboration in a diverse and agile workplace to stimulate innovation and co-creation towards achieving shared goals.

awards.title: Group winner of the sustainability trophy for planning and design of urban space
awards.description: Proposed sustainable urban design that incorporates stakeholders' interests and five development themes (pleasant living environment, urban function, housing, mobility, and sustainability). Integrated circulate metabolism in the system, developed energy-efficient and attractive transport hub, and designed multifunctional open and green spaces and building to ensure environmental integrity and economic viability.

profile_positions.company: IHS Institute for Housing and Urban Development Studies
profile_positions.description:
- Scanned project leads and funding opportunities from the national and various international institutions (i.e., NWO, RVO, Nuffic, ZonMw, ADB, WB, UNDP, ESA, Horizon Europe, MSCA, GIZ, KfW, AfDB). Alternate contact person for the EU.
- Assessed leads from different donors/sources based on multiple criteria and acquisition policies. Assisted in securing grant funding from international funding sources.
- Prepared expression of interests & requests for proposals in collaboration with academic/scientific staff.
- Discussed potential projects and collaboration opportunities with the relevant stakeholders.
- Assisted in developing project proposals/ grant applications, consortium building, and facilitated the review of the grant agreement. 
- Facilitated contract management and compliance with the organizational and funding institutions policies. 
- Responsible for the day-to-day operations of the project and provides services to the different donors, partners, and beneficiaries, ensuring the achieving organization's performance and delivery goals.
- Functioned as an intermediary among various partners involved in the project, served as the primary contact person for all funding institutions, and was responsible for internal and external communication. 
- Managed data and reports, including mailbox and project database. 
- Monitored the project implementation, evaluate project performance, and document learning (MEL) and ensured risk mitigation, meeting of deadlines, including facilitating project and financial reporting.
- As Partnership Coordinator, involved in institutional partnership building, networking, and stakeholder management
- Provided strategic support to travel management
profile_positions.title: Projects and Acquisition Officer

company.name: National Economic and Development Authority (NEDA) - Philippines

profile_positions.company: National Economic and Development Authority (NEDA) - Philippines
profile_positions.description:
• Program Lead for sustainable rural development program.
• Project Coordinator and contributing writer for the formulation of the national spatial strategy and area spatial framework plans.
• Reviewed and evaluated policies and projects related to the environment, land use, and physical
planning, socioeconomic development, urban and rural development, disaster risk reduction and climate change adaptation, and governance.
• Facilitated the preparation and evaluation of proposed policies and programs funding and/or grant assistance (e.g., OECD, Asian Development Bank, World Bank, KOICA, JICA) related to regional development, socio-economic development, sustainable development goals, and disaster risk reduction and climate change adaptation (e.g., Paris Agreement and Sendai Framework, Smart City Development, Climate-Resilient and Low-Carbon Urban Development, Country Environmental and Social Framework Assessment).
• Organized, coordinated, and participated in local and international multi-sectoral and multi-stakeholders meetings, conferences, and workshops with local and international partners (i.e., Advancing Inclusive and Resilient Development Targeted at the Urban Poor, land use meeting, 3rd International Conference on Financing for Development, Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction 2015-2030, Resilience and Preparedness Towards Inclusive Development).
• Provided secretariat and technical support to the NEDA Board-National Land Use Committee meetings and management of funds.
• Prepared reports, letters, presentation materials, aide-memoire, agenda briefs, and highlights of the meeting, organizing a calendar of activities, and coordinating travel arrangements. 
• Integrated data-driven and evidence-based research to development planning, policy research, and investment programming.

volunteer_experiences.description: As a rapporteur in the European Urban Resilience Forum 2019 co-organized by ICLEI and the European Environment Agency, I took notes and summarized discussion points, which serve as inputs to the official event report (https://urbanresilienceforum.eu/fileadmin/user_upload/Post-even_documents/2019/EURESFO-2019-report-www.pdf). The forum has three thematic streams: 1) Nature-based solutions for urban resilience: putting them into practice; 2) Improving governance for inclusive and effective climate action; and 3) Implementing, financing, and monitoring strategies for urban resilience. I had the opportunity to participate in the following breakout sessions: 1) Fostering collaboration for green infrastructure within and beyond municipal departments and 2) How to make your case: create your own nature-based solution business canvas. Also, I provided logistical support to the team.
